results.title: G'day sport
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
A slightly different look at a nation that is apparently “sports mad”. This malady and the sort of sporting competition need for most Australians is examined, as well as the extremes that people in the outback go to in order to satisfy their competitive needs

results.title: Sky bridges
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
The story of three men who fly around outback Australia to do their particular type of work. Dr Ian Robertson works for the Royal Flying Doctor Service, Tony Matthews is an Anglican Archdeacon with the Carpentaria Aerial Mission and Mervyn Moriarty is an artist teaching art with the Australian Flying Art School. Commentator: Tim Eliott
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Craftsmart: christmas special
results.creator_credit: Phillip Harris, Kingwest Productions and Lennox Television Productions
results.brief_description: Great Australian Christmas decoration ideas, with Lena Williams who gives step by step instructions to make low cost, easy and highly decorative handicrafts including a traditional Christmas wreath and an Australian Christmas table setting complete with bread basket, napkins, salt and pepper shakers and an Australian centrepiece and bon bons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip Harris, Kingwest Productions and Lennox Television Productions

results.title: Coup d'etat: the Philippines revolt
results.creator_credit: Ian Carroll, Peter Couchman, Geoff Satchell and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A documentary of the four days in February 1986 when Ferdinand Marcos was deposed as President of the Philippines. Marcos defector, Defence Minister Enrile and coup leader Captain Gringo Honason discuss the planned attack on President Marcos and his first lady Imelda in their Palace, why it failed and how Cardinal Jamie Sin and the middle class people of Manila saved the lives of new President Cory Acquino and her Government.

results.title: Country town
results.creator_credit: Julian Wintle, Max Mundrey, Sydney Box and Verity Films
results.brief_description: A study of the historic Lincolnshire town - its commerce, agriculture, and industry, its history, and its future hopes.

results.title: Country line dancing
results.brief_description: Country Line Dancing, or Bootscooting, made easy for everyone. Instructor Diane Horner of “Cowboy” in Minneapolis Minnesota demonstrates the 40 basic dance steps used in line dancing. Dances demonstrated include Electric Slide, Country Strut, Southside Shuffle, Cowboy Cha Cha, Achy Breaky, Slap Leather, Tush Push and the circle dance, Cotton Eyed Joe, plus the special bonus, Sixteen Step. The first 30 minute part is followed by more complex instructions.

results.title: Craft in the cowshed
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct method of milking cows to obtain the maximum yield of milk, and the importance of keeping the milking equipment clean.

results.title: Crac
results.creator_credit: Frederic Back, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Societe Radio-Canada
results.brief_description: Beautifully animated film which concerns itself with the lifestyle of people who lived in an age that is now past. A rocking chair, lovingly crafted from the trunk of a tall tree, is used as a linking device between generations, to show the cycle of life in a farming community in Quebec, Canada, in the nineteenth century to a museum of modern art in the twentieth century. Awards: Best animated short, Academy Awards 1981. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Kazuhiko Ikeguchi, Masahiko Minami, Shinichiro Watanabe, Bandai Visual Company, Sunrise Inc and Victor Entertainment
results.brief_description: This stylish and action packed Japanese anime television series is set in a 21st century dystopia - the earth is a wasteland and the solar system is besieged by a proliferation of gangsters. A motley group of bounty hunters, who ride aboard their rickety ship, the ‘Bebop’, reluctantly band together. The group consists of Spike Siegel, a vicious fighter whose cynicism covers painful memories; Jet Black, a former policeman; Faye Valentine, a femme fatale and compulsive gambler; and Ed, a computer hacker girl. Session 11 “Toys in the attic” When Jet is bitten by a mysterious organism, Spike and Ed are forced into the bowels of the Bebop to try to uncover the source and save their workmate. This episode has much in common with “Aliens” with a similar brand of black humour. Session 12 “Jupiter jazz (1)” Faye absconds with the Bebop loot and Jet wishes to retrieve her but Spike is more interested in tracking down Julia, his long-lost love - a quest which draws him into confrontation with arch-nemesis, Vicious. Session 13 “Jupiter jazz (2)” As Jet hunts for Faye and the missing money, Faye tries to uncover the secrets of the elusive Gren, a man/woman seeking vengeance. Session 14 “Bohemian rhapsody” After a series of robberies at the high tech toll booths that control interstellar travel, the Bebop crew are enlisted to track down the perpetrators. “Cowboy Bebop” is an amusing cross-pollination between anime, the Western, classic Sci-fi flicks, and neo-noir with an anti-hero narrative overlayed with ultra cool aesthetics.
